result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey S. Knutson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice

Defendant is experiencing sudden severe health issues and is applying for SSI.  Court amends payment plan to $25 per month starting June 15, 2019 and due by the 15th day of each month until 15CM132 and 15CM433 are paid in full.  Address verified.  Advised that further extension requests would have to be in writing for Judge's approval.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Rhodes.  Court orders $1,500 Signature Bond with conditions.
Initial Appearance- March 16, 2015 @ 9:00 a.m.
Initial appearance on March 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON SIGNING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am, except for work purposes, treatment purposes, NA or AA, as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program.
No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
